snippet: A bill pending before the City Council would require co-op board members to sign a statement saying that they did not discriminate on the basis of race and other criteria when turning down an applicant.
abstract: Bill pending before City Council would require co-op board members to sign statement saying that they did not discriminate on the basis of race or other criteria, in violation of fair housing laws, when rejecting applicants; also includes a provision that would impose a 45-day deadline on boards to accept or deny an application; idea is to prevent use of delays or nonresponses as a way to discriminate.
lead_paragraph: A bill pending before the City Council would require co-op board members to sign a statement saying that they did not discriminate on the basis of race and other criteria when turning down an applicant.

headline.seo: Bill Seeks to Curb Discrimination by Co-op Boards
headline.main: Proposals Seek to Curb Bias by Co-op Boards
headline.print_headline: Proposals Seek to Curb Bias by Co-op Boards
